content:
Hello.

I see in https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/overview/changelog.html that the 4.0 version is released. And i see in this page....

https://chat.zulip.org/api/v1/server_settings

that the version of this chat (the one where i'm writting) is 4.0.

So I made a upgrade by typing...

wget https://www.zulip.org/dist/releases/zulip-server-latest.tar.gz
/home/zulip/deployments/current/scripts/upgrade-zulip zulip-server-latest.tar.gz

But if i enter in my zulip instance, following this link...

https://chat.tabigal.com/api/v1/server_settings

I can see that i'm still in the 3.3 version.

¿Is 4.0 still in beta releases? ¿When 4.0 will be released? I suppose that there is no problem in my installation if i made an update of the same version that i have. isn't it?
4.0 is not released yet, we are just making preparations for it.
The upgrade you did, shouldn't pose any problems.

I see in https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/overview/changelog.html that the 4.0 version is released. And i see in this page....

It says Unreleased.

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

4.0 is not released yet, we are just making preparations for it.

OK. I supposed that 4.0 version was released because this chat was running it. I think that i didn't read the "unreleased" tag in the post. :upside_down: Thanks.

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

The upgrade you did, shouldn't pose any problems.

OK. Since i try to upgrade yesterday, i didn't have any trouble, so i think that i didn't break anything. :grinning: Thanks.

Marcos Matas Sobral said:

Aman Agrawal (amanagr) said:

4.0 is not released yet, we are just making preparations for it.

OK. I supposed that 4.0 version was released because this chat was running it. I think that i didn't read the "unreleased" tag in the post. :upside_down: Thanks.

This chat is updated regularly so we can test the new features and commits for bug fixes in the real world and allows us to catch any errors before the actual release.

We should probably update the text at the top of the changelog to make it more obvious what is released and isn't.

A related issue I want to solve is that https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/overview/changelog.html doesn't mention that there's changes in the /latest/ tree.

We can fix that last problem with one of these notices:
image.png

Hello there,
On the same subject, currently running version 3.3. Should I upgrade to 3.4 first, or can I jump to 4.2 directly?

@Steve Durrheimer you can go to 4.2 directly; I just wouldn't upgrade to anything but the newest in a given major release series, but there's no need to upgrade to the last release in a previous minor release series first.
